class Solution:
    def minimumCost(self, m: int, n: int, horizontalCut: List[int], verticalCut: List[int]) -> int:
        # Sort both lists of cuts in descending order of costs
        horizontalCut.sort(reverse=True)
        verticalCut.sort(reverse=True)

        # Initialize counters for the number of segments in each direction
        horizontal_segments = 1  # Starts as one whole piece
        vertical_segments = 1    # Starts as one whole piece

        # Initialize total cost
        total_cost = 0

        # Pointers for horizontal and vertical cuts
        i, j = 0, 0

        # Process each cut by selecting the highest cost available cut next
        while i < len(horizontalCut) or j < len(verticalCut):
            # Decide whether to cut horizontally or vertically next
            if j < len(verticalCut) and (i >= len(horizontalCut) or verticalCut[j] >= horizontalCut[i]):
                # Make a vertical cut, affecting all horizontal segments
                total_cost += verticalCut[j] * horizontal_segments
                vertical_segments += 1
                j += 1
            else:
                # Make a horizontal cut, affecting all vertical segments
                total_cost += horizontalCut[i] * vertical_segments
                horizontal_segments += 1
                i += 1

        return total_cost
